Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the cost of the president's trip to India by stating that it will cost taxpayers $200 million a day.
Understate: The claim may understate the actual cost of the trip, as it is disputed by the White House and deemed as wildly inflated.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a single source, a news agency in India, relying on an anonymous source.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the cost of the trip is excessive and an example of government excess and overspending.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not provide alternative explanations for the purpose or cost of the president's trip.
